parameters.name: ChordTolerance
parameters.description: Chord tolerance to use in tessellation (meters); this is the maximum permitted distance from a cord to the curve between the cord endpoints; the smallest allowable value for this parameter is 1E-8; if 0.0 or a value smaller than 1E-8 is specified, then 1E-8 is used by default

parameters.name: LengthTolerance
parameters.description: Length tolerance to be used to filter out very short segments (meters); this method does not return tessellated segments shorter than this value

parameters.name: StartPoint
parameters.description: Array containing the start point of the curve

parameters.name: EndPoint
parameters.description: Array containing the end point of the curve

title: ICurve.GetTessPts
description: Gets a set of points that represent the tessellation of this curve.
signature:
System.Object GetTessPts( 
   System.Double
ChordTolerance
,
   System.Double
LengthTolerance
,
   System.Object
StartPoint
,
   System.Object
EndPoint
)

parameters.name: ChordTolerance
parameters.description: Chord tolerance to use in tessellation (meters); this is the maximum permitted distance from a cord to the curve between the cord endpoints; the smallest allowable value for this parameter is 1E-8; if 0.0 or a value smaller than 1E-8 is specified, then 1E-8 is used by default

parameters.name: LengthTolerance
parameters.description: Length tolerance to be used to filter out very short segments (meters); this method does not return tessellated segments shorter than this value

parameters.name: StartPoint
parameters.description: Array containing the start point of the curve

parameters.name: EndPoint
parameters.description: Array containing the end point of the curve

returns: Array of doubles containing the tessellation points (see Remarks )
remarks:
The array returned contains the x, y, z location of the tessellation points:
[
x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2,
...
]

examples.title: Create Space Parameter Curve on Surface (VBA)
